ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: You had an irresistible urge to continue drinking once you'd started
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: Once you started drinking you developed a powerful desire for more
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: Once you started drinking you felt like you had no ''off-switch''
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: Once you started drinking, it seemed like that feeling you were looking for was always just one more drink away
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: One drink caused you to keep drinking until you physically couldn't anymore
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: One drink caused you to keep drinking until you ran out of alcohol
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: You were unable to stop drinking once you'd started
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered

ElementDescription: You ended up having many more drinks than you intended to
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always; -5= Not answered
